This technology has found applications in a diverse range of domains, such as credit card datasets.

all_datasets.title: Graph Positional and Structural Encoder
all_datasets.justification: MolPCBA is explicitly used for pre-training GPSE.
all_datasets.quote: Training dataset PCQM4Mv2 (Hu et al., 2021) is a typical choice of pre-training dataset for molecular tasks. However, since GPSE only extracts features from graph structures (e.g., methane, CH4, would be treated as the same graph as silane, SiH4), the amount of training samples reduces to 273,920 after extracting unique graphs. Instead, we train GPSE with MolPCBA (Hu et al., 2020a) with 323,555 unique molecular graphs and an average number of 25 nodes.

all_datasets.title: Graph Positional and Structural Encoder
all_datasets.justification: ZINC dataset is used for downstream evaluation of GPSE.
all_datasets.quote: In these experiments, we demonstrate that GPSE provides more performance improvements over traditional PSEs for a wide range of GNN models. Additionally, we show competitive performance achieved by GPSE against the complementary self-supervised learning (SSL) pre-training approaches. GPSE-augmented GPS is highly competitive on molecular graph benchmarks. We compare the performance of the GPS model augmented with our GPSE encodings versus the same model using (a) no PSE, (b) random features as PSE, (c) LapPE and RWSE, and (d) concatenation of PSEs from §2.1 on four common molecular property prediction benchmarks (Dwivedi et al., 2022a; Hu et al., 2020a; 2021). For ZINC (Gómez-Bombarelli et al., 2018), and PCQM4Mv2 (Hu et al., 2020a), we use their subset versions following Dwivedi et al. (2022a) and Rampášek et al. (2022), respectively.

Self-supervised GPSE training to recover various PSEs … Nx BN & MLP Concatenation Offl... arXiv:2307.07107v2 [cs.LG] 10 Jun 2024 ages the advantages of both the inductive bias of the local message passing (Battaglia et al., 2018) and the expressiveness of the global attention (Vaswani et al., 2017). As it has previously attained SOTA results on a variety of benchmarks using hand-crafted PSEs, GPS is a natural baseline model to demonstrate the effectiveness of GPSE. We also validate GPSE for other graph Transformers & MPNNs in our experiments, and thus show that utility of GPSE is not bound to any particular architecture. MNIST molhiv ZINC

all_datasets.title: Self-supervised anomaly detection in computer vision and beyond: A survey and outlook.
all_datasets.justification: The dataset CIFAR-10 is used for benchmarking several self-supervised anomaly detection algorithms in the paper.
all_datasets.quote: CIFAR-10 (Krizhevsky et al.), and MVTecAD (Bergmann et al., 2019) are two of the most common dataset that recent anomaly detection papers used.

all_datasets.title: Self-supervised anomaly detection in computer vision and beyond: A survey and outlook.
all_datasets.justification: MVTecAD is used for benchmarking self-supervised anomaly detection methods, especially in the context of defect detection.
all_datasets.quote: For instance, Salehi et al. (2020) used the idea of solving the jigsaw puzzle for learning an efficient representation that can be used for pixel-level anomaly detection. Their proposed method, which they named as Puzzle-AE, trains a U-Net autoencoder to reconstruct the puzzled input. The reconstruction objective ensures that the model is sensitive to the pixel-level anomalies, while the pretext task of solving the puzzle enables the network to capture high-level semantic information, as shown in Fig. 2. They further boosted the performance of their model by incorporating adversarial training.

all_datasets.title: Self-supervised anomaly detection in computer vision and beyond: A survey and outlook.
all_datasets.justification: SVHN is mentioned in the context of Out-of-Distribution detection as a dataset used to test the generalization of models trained on CIFAR-10.
all_datasets.quote: To benchmark an OOD algorithm, it is common to train a model on the CIFAR-10 dataset and test the model using another dataset. If the samples of the test datasets are similar to the CIFAR-10 to some extent, the task is called near-OOD detection (e.g. CIFAR-10 vs. CIFAR-100). Otherwise, it is referred to as far-OOD detection (e.g. CIFAR-10 vs. SVHN, or CIFAR-10 vs. LSUN).

all_datasets.title: Policy Gradient Methods in the Presence of Symmetries and State Abstractions
all_datasets.justification: The dataset is explicitly mentioned and used throughout the experiments in the paper.
all_datasets.quote: We empirically show that state-action abstractions learned through MDP homomorphisms provide a natural inductive bias for representation learning on challenging visual control problems, resulting in performance and sample efficiency improvements over strong baselines. Finally, we show how to collapse an MDP when there is a group of symmetries which is also continuous. Thus, for example if a system is spherically symmetric the system is invariant under the action of the rotation group SO(3) and this is certainly not a finite group. Discrete symmetries can and do occur in continuous systems but in general one will be dealing with continuous symmetries. Additionally, to demonstrate the ability of DHPG in learning continuous symmetries, we have developed a series of environments with continuous symmetries.In summary, our contributions can be listed as:

all_datasets.title: MasakhaPOS: Part-of-Speech Tagging for Typologically Diverse African languages
all_datasets.justification: MasakhaPOS is the primary dataset introduced and utilized in this paper for POS tagging of African languages.
all_datasets.quote: We provide extensive POS baselines using conditional random field (CRF) and several multilingual pretrained language models (PLMs). Furthermore, we experimented with different parameter-efficient cross-lingual transfer methods (Pfeiffer et al., 2021; Ansell et al., 2022), and transfer languages with available training data in the UD. Our evaluation demonstrates that choosing the best transfer language(s) in both single-source and multi-source setups leads to large improvements in POS tagging performance, especially when combined with parameter-fine-tuning methods.

all_datasets.justification: CIFAR-10 is used as one of the main datasets for evaluating the proposed model.
all_datasets.quote: We present each set for 2000 epochs, which in an ordinary architecture would cause catastrophic forgetting of the previous sets. We perform five replications of each model with different random seeds, with the seed also re-sampling the class splits to avoid selecting any favourable class split. Importantly, we study one of the hardest yet most realistic settings in continual learning by not allowing any memory replay or provision of task boundaries which is required by the vast majority of existing continual learning methods. To the best of our knowledge, the only method that can deal with this learning scenario is (Bricken et al., 2023). We report experiments on five publicly available backbones including:.

Unfortunately, no such resource provides a classification of all nodes in the Penn Treebank (or CHILDES, MacWhinney 2000, which we use in our next study). However, for a subset of the phrases in the Penn Treebank, such information is available in the PropBank corpus (Palmer et al. 2005) which provides annotations of argument and modifier structure for all of the verbal predicates in the Wall Street Journal portion of the corpus.

all_datasets.quote: We experiment with Celeb A...Our task with CelebA is to classify pictures based on whether the person is blond or not.

all_datasets.title: Lazy vs hasty: linearization in deep networks impacts learning schedule based on example difficulty
all_datasets.justification: The Waterbirds dataset is utilized to study spurious correlations in image classification tasks.
all_datasets.quote: We experiment with Celeb A (Liu et al., 2015) and Waterbirds (Wah et al., 2011) datasets.

all_datasets.title: IGLUE: A Benchmark for Transfer Learning across Modalities, Tasks, and Languages
all_datasets.justification: The paper introduces this new dataset/task as part of the IGLUE benchmark for visual entailment.
all_datasets.quote: We propose the new task of Cross-lingual Visual Natural Language Inference (XVNLI).

all_datasets.title: IGLUE: A Benchmark for Transfer Learning across Modalities, Tasks, and Languages
all_datasets.justification: xGQA is introduced in the paper as a dataset for evaluating cross-lingual visual question answering tasks.
all_datasets.quote: To solve the Cross-lingual Grounded Question Answering task (xGQA; Pfeiffer et al. 2022), a model must answer several types of structured questions.

all_datasets.title: IGLUE: A Benchmark for Transfer Learning across Modalities, Tasks, and Languages
all_datasets.justification: The paper introduces MaRVL as part of the benchmark, highlighting its unique focus on multicultural reasoning involving both vision and language.
all_datasets.quote: The Multicultural Reasoning over Vision and Language dataset (Liu et al., 2021) requires to determine whether a textual description is true or false about a pair of images.

all_datasets.title: IGLUE: A Benchmark for Transfer Learning across Modalities, Tasks, and Languages
all_datasets.justification: As part of the IGLUE benchmark, xFlickr&CO is introduced for multilingual retrieval tasks, combining data from Flickr30K and COCO datasets.
all_datasets.quote: We create a new, multilingual evaluation set for retrieval by combining 1,000 images from the Flickr30K and 1,000 from the COCO test split.

all_datasets.title: IGLUE: A Benchmark for Transfer Learning across Modalities, Tasks, and Languages
all_datasets.justification: WIT (Wikipedia-based Image Text) is cited as a diverse dataset within the benchmark, representing real-world entities for retrieval tasks.
all_datasets.quote: The Wikipedia-based Image Text dataset (Srinivasan et al., 2021) collected examples from Wikipedia in 108 languages.

all_datasets.title: Learning with Rejection for Abstractive Text Summarization
all_datasets.justification: The XSUM dataset is used for training and evaluating the models.
all_datasets.quote: We evaluated our method on the XSUM (Narayan et al., 2018) dataset.

all_datasets.title: Learning with Rejection for Abstractive Text Summarization
all_datasets.justification: The XENT dataset is used for fine-grained entity-level factuality analysis.
all_datasets.quote: For fine-grained entity-level factuality analysis (see Section 5.1), we use the XENT dataset created by Cao et al. (2022).

all_datasets.title: Compositional Attention: Disentangling Search and Retrieval
all_datasets.justification: The dataset is used to evaluate relational reasoning capabilities of the proposed attention mechanism.
all_datasets.quote: Sort-of-CLEVR is a Visual Question-Answering (VQA) task.

all_datasets.title: Compositional Attention: Disentangling Search and Retrieval
all_datasets.justification: SCAN is a benchmark used to assess the compositional generalization capabilities of models.
all_datasets.quote: SCAN (Lake & Baroni, 2018a) is a synthetic sequence to sequence task.

all_datasets.title: Compositional Attention: Disentangling Search and Retrieval
all_datasets.justification: Used for language modeling experiments to evaluate performance improvements of the proposed model.
all_datasets.quote: We perform experiments on the WikiText-103 data corpus for the language modeling task.

all_datasets.title: Compositional Attention: Disentangling Search and Retrieval
all_datasets.justification: CIFAR-10 is used to evaluate the model on image classification tasks.
all_datasets.quote: We pose the problem of image classification across four different datasets – CIFAR10, FashionMNIST, SVHN and Equilateral Triangle Detection as a multi-task learning setup.

all_datasets.title: Learning Representations for New Sound Classes With Continual Self-Supervised Learning
all_datasets.justification: UrbanSound8K is used as a dataset for training and evaluation in the paper.
all_datasets.quote: We use UrbanSound8K to continually train the encoder.

all_datasets.title: Learning Representations for New Sound Classes With Continual Self-Supervised Learning
all_datasets.justification: This dataset is used for experiment evaluations, as stated in the methodology.
all_datasets.quote: The TAU Urban Acoustic Scenes 2019 dataset is used for the DCASE 2019 Task-1(A) challenge for acoustic scene classification.

all_datasets.title: Learning Representations for New Sound Classes With Continual Self-Supervised Learning
all_datasets.justification: VGGSound is mentioned as a dataset for evaluating and learning representations within the framework.
all_datasets.quote: VGGSound is used to learn representations for OOD experiments.

all_datasets.title: Feeding What You Need by Understanding What You Learned
all_datasets.justification: SQuADv1 is used as one of the datasets for evaluating the models in the paper.
all_datasets.quote: We employ two question styles to evaluate our CBBC: answer span extraction and multiple choice. The former consists of SQuADv1 (Rajpurkar et al., 2016),

all_datasets.title: Feeding What You Need by Understanding What You Learned
all_datasets.justification: SQuADv2 is used to train and test the models as per the experimental setup.
all_datasets.quote: we also report the results of scaled F 1 (denoted as F logits ) by taking the model’s confidence to an answer span or candidate into account.

all_datasets.title: Feeding What You Need by Understanding What You Learned
all_datasets.justification: HotpotQA is used in the experiments as one of the datasets for testing the models.
all_datasets.quote: Extensive experiments on four benchmark datasets demonstrate that our approach significantly improves the performance of existing MRC models.

all_datasets.title: Feeding What You Need by Understanding What You Learned
all_datasets.justification: RACE is utilized in the paper as a benchmark dataset for evaluating the proposed models.
all_datasets.quote: the latter adopts RACE (Lai et al., 2017). For each dataset, we train and evaluate the model on official training and dev split, respectively.

all_datasets.title: Adjusting Machine Learning Decisions for Equal Opportunity and Counterfactual Fairness
all_datasets.justification: The paper evaluates its fairness algorithms using public data on criminal defendants and recidivism scores.
all_datasets.quote: We study these approaches on simulated admissions data and on three public datasets, about income, credit, and recidivism.

all_datasets.title: Adjusting Machine Learning Decisions for Equal Opportunity and Counterfactual Fairness
all_datasets.justification: The Adult Income dataset is one of the datasets used in the empirical evaluation.
all_datasets.quote: The adult income data (Dua & Graff, 2017a) and the German credit data (Dua & Graff, 2017b) contain data about people and decisions about which are loan worthy.

all_datasets.title: Adjusting Machine Learning Decisions for Equal Opportunity and Counterfactual Fairness
all_datasets.justification: The German Credit dataset is utilized to validate the proposed fair decision algorithms.
all_datasets.quote: The adult income data (Dua & Graff, 2017a) and the German credit data (Dua & Graff, 2017b) contain data about people and decisions about which are loan worthy.

all_datasets.title: MixEHR-Guided: A guided multi-modal topic modeling approach for large-scale automatic phenotyping using the electronic health record
all_datasets.justification: MIMIC-III is explicitly mentioned as one of the datasets used for applying the MixEHR-G model.
all_datasets.quote: We applied MixEHR-G to an openly-available EHR dataset of 38,597 intensive care patients (MIMIC-III) in Boston, USA.

all_datasets.title: MixEHR-Guided: A guided multi-modal topic modeling approach for large-scale automatic phenotyping using the electronic health record
all_datasets.justification: PopHR is explicitly mentioned as one of the datasets used for applying the MixEHR-G model.
all_datasets.quote: We applied MixEHR-G to...administrative claims data for a population-based cohort (PopHR) of 1.3 million people in Quebec, Canada.

all_datasets.title: Organizing Principles of Astrocytic Nanoarchitecture in the Mouse Cerebral Cortex
all_datasets.justification: The dataset used in the study consists of high-resolution images of astrocytes in the layer 2/3 mouse somatosensory cortex.
all_datasets.quote: We produced and analyzed multiple, high-resolution datasets of layer 2/3 mouse somatosensory cortex using focused ion beam scanning electron microscopy (8nm intervals) and computer vision approaches.

all_datasets.title: 3D Infomax improves GNNs for Molecular Property Prediction
all_datasets.justification: QM9 is used as one of the datasets for pre-training the models with 3D information.
all_datasets.quote: For pre-training, we use three datasets of molecules with 3D information: QM9 (Ramakrishnan et al. 2014).

all_datasets.title: 3D Infomax improves GNNs for Molecular Property Prediction
all_datasets.justification: GEOM-Drugs is used as one of the datasets for pre-training with multiple conformers.
all_datasets.quote: On 140k of GEOM-Drugs with 5 conformers and, (3) on 620k of QMugs using 3 conformers.

all_datasets.title: 3D Infomax improves GNNs for Molecular Property Prediction
all_datasets.justification: QMugs is used as a dataset in the experiments for pre-training with drug-like molecules.
all_datasets.quote: On 620k of QMugs using 3 conformers.

all_datasets.title: Resolution enhancement with a task-assisted GAN to guide optical nanoscopy image analysis and acquisition
all_datasets.justification: This dataset is used to train and evaluate the TA-GAN model for generating super-resolved images of axonal F-actin.
all_datasets.quote:
The first TA-GAN model is trained to generate STED images of the axonal
F-actin lattice from confocal images (Figure 1b).

all_datasets.title: Resolution enhancement with a task-assisted GAN to guide optical nanoscopy image analysis and acquisition
all_datasets.justification: This dataset is essential for evaluating the TA-GAN and TA-CycleGAN models, focusing on dendritic F-actin structures.
all_datasets.quote:
The performance of the TA-GAN is next evaluated on a more complex task,
which is the semantic segmentation of two nanostructures that can be differentiated only with super-resolution optical microscopy: dendritic F-actin rings
and fibers [3, 44].

all_datasets.title: Resolution enhancement with a task-assisted GAN to guide optical nanoscopy image analysis and acquisition
all_datasets.justification: This dataset is utilized to train the TA-GAN model for super-resolution tasks involving synaptic proteins.
all_datasets.quote:
We use automatically generated localization annotations to train the
TA-GAN for confocal-to-STED super-resolution of the Synaptic protein dataset
consisting of two-channels images of synaptic proteins clusters [4].

all_datasets.title: Resolution enhancement with a task-assisted GAN to guide optical nanoscopy image analysis and acquisition
all_datasets.justification: This dataset is crucial for the evaluation of the TA-CycleGAN model, enabling adaptation to live-cell conditions.
all_datasets.quote:
A large FOV was first imaged at low-resolution from which regions were manually
selected by an expert. For each region selected, a confocal and a STED image
were acquired sequentially. The Live F-actin dataset consists in 904 paired
STED and confocal images of F-actin stained with the fluorogenic dye SiR-
Actin (Spirochrome, US) in living hippocampal cultured neurons. The dataset
was split into a training set (833 images) and a validation set (71 images).

all_datasets.title: Resolution enhancement with a task-assisted GAN to guide optical nanoscopy image analysis and acquisition
all_datasets.dataset_name: Dendritic F-actin dataset adapted to the live-cell STED imaging domain
all_datasets.justification: This adapted dataset is generated using the TA-CycleGAN to train a network for live-cell imaging.
all_datasets.quote: This dataset corresponds to the Dendritic F-actin dataset adapted to the live-cell STED imaging domain using the TA-CycleGAN for fixed-to-live domain adaptation

all_datasets.title: The Machine Learning for Combinatorial Optimization Competition (ML4CO): Results and Insights
all_datasets.justification: This is one of the datasets specifically evaluated on during the competition, as part of the problem benchmarks.
all_datasets.quote: Benchmark 1: Balanced Item Placement This problem involves spreading items, e.g., files or processes, across containers...

all_datasets.title: The Machine Learning for Combinatorial Optimization Competition (ML4CO): Results and Insights
all_datasets.justification: This is another dataset explicitly mentioned and utilized in the competition for evaluating solutions on a problem benchmark.
all_datasets.quote: Benchmark 2: Workload Apportionment This problem deals with apportioning workloads, e.g., data streams, across as few workers, e.g., servers, as possible.

all_datasets.title: The Machine Learning for Combinatorial Optimization Competition (ML4CO): Results and Insights
all_datasets.justification: This is one of the datasets used in the competition, specifically as part of the challenging tasks presented.
all_datasets.quote: Benchmark 3: Maritime Inventory Routing (Anonymous Problem) This problem plays an integral role in global bulk shipping.

all_datasets.title: Overview of the TREC 2021 Fair Ranking Track
all_datasets.justification: The dataset used in the tasks is described as a subset of the English Wikipedia.
all_datasets.quote: Participants were provided with a corpus of documents (a subset of the English language Wikipedia) and a set of queries.

all_datasets.title: A Reduction from Reinforcement Learning to No-Regret Online Learning
all_datasets.justification: The paper demonstrates the effectiveness of its proposed algorithm using tabular MDPs.
all_datasets.quote: We prove that, for any tabular Markov decision process (MDP), with probability at least 1 − δ, this algorithm learns an ǫ-optimal policy

all_datasets.title: Fractal impedance for passive controllers: a framework for interaction robotics
all_datasets.justification: No specific datasets were mentioned in the paper; the experiments were conducted directly on a robotic system rather than with pre-existing datasets.
all_datasets.quote: The experiments conducted using a Panda 7-DoF Arm (Franka Emika GmbH, DE).

all_datasets.title: Neural Multisensory Scene Inference
all_datasets.justification: The MESE is the environment specifically developed for the experiments conducted in this paper.
all_datasets.quote: We also develop the Multisensory Embodied 3D-Scene Environment (MESE) used to develop and test the model.

all_datasets.title: Neural Multisensory Scene Inference
all_datasets.justification: The Shepard-Metzler Dataset is used as a basis for generating the 3D scenes utilized in the experiments.
